title: Forces and Motion: Push and Pull

vocab.definition: Using force to move something away from you
Using force to move something toward you
A push or pull that makes things move
When something moves from one place to another

teachingNotes: Use playground equipment and toys for hands-on exploration. Demonstrate pushing and pulling with various objects. Safety emphasis.

sample.question: When you open a door, are you pushing or pulling?
How do you make a toy car move?
What happens when you push something?
How do you move a wagon?
What kind of force makes things move?

truefalse.question: You push a swing to make it move.
expectedAny: pushing swings makes them go forward

truefalse.question: Pulling always makes things come toward you.
You need force to move heavy things.
Pushing and pulling are the same thing.
expectedAny: pushing moves away, pulling brings closer

truefalse.question: You can move things without touching them.
expectedAny: you need to touch to push or pull

truefalse.question: Wind can push things.
expectedAny: wind is a natural pushing force

truefalse.question: Only people can create forces.
expectedAny: animals and machines create forces too

multiplechoice.question: What happens when you push a ball?
expectedAny: pushing makes the ball move away from you

multiplechoice.question: How do you make a sled move?
expectedAny: sleds need pushing or pulling to move

multiplechoice.question: What do you do to close a drawer?
expectedAny: you push drawers to close them

multiplechoice.question: Which needs more force to move?
When you pull a rope, what happens?
What makes a bicycle move?
expectedAny: pedaling creates force to move bike

multiplechoice.question: How do you pick up a toy?
expectedAny: you pull upward to lift things

fillintheblank.question: When you _____ a wagon, it moves toward you.
To make a ball roll away, you _____ it.
_____ and _____ are two kinds of forces.
When something moves, it is in _____.
You need _____ to make things move.
To open most doors, you _____ them.
Heavy things need more _____ to move them.

shortanswer.question: Give an example of something you push and something you pull.
How do forces help us in everyday life?
What happens when you push something really hard?
Why are heavy things hard to move?
Name three things at the playground that you push or pull.
How can you tell if something is moving?
expectedAny: goes from one place to another

shortanswer.question: What would happen if there were no forces?

wordProblems.question: Sam pushes 3 toy cars and pulls 2 wagons. How many things did he move using force?
There are 4 swings at the playground. If 2 children push swings and 1 child pulls a swing, how many swings are being moved?
Emma uses force to move 6 blocks. If she pushes 4 blocks and pulls the rest, how many blocks did she pull?
In PE class, 5 children push balls and 3 children pull ropes. How many children are using forces?
Tom pushes a box 2 feet, then pulls it back 1 foot. How far is the box from where it started?
There are 7 doors in the school. If you push 3 doors and pull 4 doors, how many doors did you move?
Lisa can push 2 light objects or 1 heavy object at a time. If she pushes 3 times, moving light objects each time, how many light objects did she move?
